page.title: 03Big Buildings in Calbourne
page.content: { WESTOVER,}originally the Manor house, is on the site of an earlier dwelling. It dates from the 18th century and is built in Regency style. It is now owned by a doctor and his family. Many of the outbuildings and former staff cottages are used as self-catering holiday accommodation. The former{RECTORY,}basically a Tudor building with some later additions, was sold early in the l980s and is now part private home and part let as en suite bedrooms to holiday guests. The{CHURCH,}dedicated to{ALL {SAINTS,}was begun in Norman times, but is now a good example of a thirteenth century church, with the North transept rebuilt in the 19th century as the chapel of the Barrington Simeon family. The church is now linked with those of Shalfleet and Newtown.
